data.title: Apple on Steve Jobs: 'The world is immeasurably better because of Steve'
data.meta_description: Steve Jobs managed to live more than seven years with a rare form of pancreatic cancer that grows more slowly than the common kind.
data.text:
•

He is widely credited for the design choices that made the iMac, iPod, iPhone and iPad hits. He was known for his attention to detail, in one case calling a Google employee on a Sunday to discuss the color yellow in the Google logo in an iPhone app.

•

Steve Jobs managed to live more than seven years with a rare form of pancreatic cancer that grows more slowly than the common kind.

•

CUPERTINO, Calif. — Apple says the company's co-founder Steve Jobs has died. He was 56.

•

[WIRED.COM]

Steven Paul Jobs, 56, died Wednesday at his home with his family. The co-founder and, until last August, CEO of Apple Inc was the most celebrated person in technology and business on the planet. No one will take issue with the official Apple statement that “The world is immeasurably better because of Steve.”

•

[WIRED.COM]

Find me a person, anywhere, who doesn’t call him Steve.

•

[WIRED.COM]

In a way, Steve Jobs might have saved the best “One Last Thing” for last: The legendary and now former Apple CEO has left his company in fine hands and on a path of prospects as great as his final years at the helm have provided.

•

[THE INDEPENDENT]

The worlds of politics, business, sport and entertainment joined forces today to pay tribute to Apple co-founder Steve Jobs.

•

[WHITEHOUSE.GOV]

And there may be no greater tribute to Steve’s success than the fact that much of the world learned of his passing on a device he invented.
